title: Antisocial Networking
text:
I am tired of the way that we communicate with each other in this day in age. Social networking (i.e. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.) has ruined so many people's ability to create a meaningful relationship. What ever happened to talking in person? It is so ridiculous that even if people are together, many of them are glued to their phones! Wake up you drones! Personally I don't like to communicate online or by text. I don't like talking on the phone either. I like to get away, out in nature, where the distractions aren't so in your face, and where I can be in the moment with someone. We have become so disconnected from nature. We are so stressed all the time, because we never get away from the b.s. we deal with. 

The reason I am posting here is I hope to find some friends that I can connect with. By connect I mean that we have similar hobbies, ideas, etc. I can't believe how hard it is to find genuine people on here. 

I like to hike, run, fish, camp, read, question everything, laugh, watch movies, people watch, blow my mind by natural means. I entered the rabbit hole years ago, so it would be nice to find someone down here to be friends with...

I want to communicate this way just long enough to establish a friendship. As soon as possible, I would like to find someone to hang out with OUTSIDE, IN NATURE! Let's get out of this matrix, and go do something meaningful.

title: Female Workout Buddy Needed
text:
First and foremost, I am a woman and am only looking for female workout partners. I don't mean to discriminate against men, I am just most comfortable working out in front of/with females.

So I've been living in Vegas for almost a year with my husband, but haven't made many friends, and those that I have made cannot or do not want to do workout activities with me. Those activities might include hiking, walking, rock climbing, gym, yoga, dancing, etc. I am open to trying new workout routines and activities. But if any of those sound fun to you, please send me an email :)

I'll be honest; I am not in shape, but I hope that I can lose weight and tone up. I don't mind your size, big or small, in shape or not. I just want to be able to motivate each other towards our goals. I am in my twenties, but I do not mind what age you are.

I live in Summerlin, so someone in the North/Northeast/East area would probably be best since we could probably meet more often, but I am not opposed to any location; we just might not work out together too much (hiking trips would be fun though). I do not have a gym membership, but have been contemplating getting one (I've really only thought about 24hr fitness or LVAC, but I'll consider other gyms too).

So if you too are looking for a workout partner, please send me an email :) I look forward to hearing from you! Put your favorite TV show as your subject please...

title: Looking to actually hang out!
text:
Hey. Im 29. 

Im from Virginia... but I live in southern Utah currently, and I work an awesome job with an interesting schedule that allows for a lot of periods with several days off at a time. Since Utah is a fucking hell hole, I often come to Vegas to chill and get good food and shit like that.

I'll be in Vegas today (sunday) and I'll be staying in a hotel tonight and headed back to UT tomorrow afternoon, but I come down fairly often and Im looking for someone (or several someone's) to chill with when Im there. 

Two things to know: 1. I dont come to Vegas looking to spend a bunch of fucking money when Im there... haha. So Im not looking to go to the club or rack up a hundred dollar bar tab spontaneously or whatever. So, the emphasis on this ad is that Im looking for hanging out in a low key way most of the time. I enjoy going to hookah lounges and chilling and talking for hours, I like seeing movies and grabbing ice cream or something afterward, and I love getting good food. All of these things gotta include good conversation! And if we hit it off and hang a few times Im down to plan more expensive activities, but yeah, not looking to go crazy. Haha. 

2. I dont want to meet you at a bar for the first time we hang out. I dont really like drinking in Vegas usually. Its fucking expensive and it impairs driving and decision making! Haha. Just saying, Id rather get to know you without any substances involved and without having to worry about driving safely... make sense?

I dont smoke or do any drugs, but I dont care if you do (as long as its within reason). If youre one of those people who cant talk about anything but weed or is going to badger me about smoking with you, Im not interested. Otherwise, I dont mind. 

I also want to mention that this is Craigslist. Haha. And this is a strictly platonic ad. And as they say that people are only looking for sex on here no matter what the category, I want to clarify a few things. It would be totally awesome if we hung out and decided we wanted to have some casual intimacy as friends (once or often if we choose to hang out often) or even if we decided we wanted to try to date or something. Also, I am totally capable of being "just friends" with women. So, I would ask that when you respond you either clarify that you're open to whatever/dont have any expectations, or that you are only looking for just friends. And part of the idea with if youre open to possibilities is that we will talk about it at some point. If youre not able to have that kind of conversation or arent comfortable with being honest... probably not a great idea to answer my ad...

Additionally, Im not interested in hanging out with any married/attached/taken straight females. If youre not single, youre straight, and youre looking for male friends on CL, something isnt right. Partnered women with non male partners looking for male friends are totally encouraged to reply!

Today Im planning to get some lunch, maybe see a movie, check into my hotel, and hit up a hookah lounge for most of the evening (I guess dinner will be in there somewhere too, kinda feeling benihana but who knows). I'll probably just work on some work there if I cant find anyone to chill with! Feel free to hit me up anytime and see whats up!

title: Musician computer geek stoner in Seattle seeks friends for conversatio
text:
Hi there. Have you thought about moving to the PNW? Or maybe you're just bored and want a new friend to exchange emails with. Whatever the case may be, I'm available for email or chat. Please only respond if you're going to take the time to write a decent response; no one-liners please. I appreciate well-written letters and I tend to get along with creative/intellectual types. I have been missing that type of connection lately.

So, being that I live in Seattle, you may have me somewhat figured out. I smoke weed, I drink coffee, I work in technology, and I'm progressive. I have LGBT friends and family. So, we may not mesh well if you're religious or conservative, though I'm open for debating stuff if that's your thing.

I work in IT for a popular retail company. As I mentioned, I work a night shift which leaves me fairly isolated, however I only work 3-4 nights a week, so that's nice because it allows me time to work on music and do other productive things like play video games and watch movies. I like working nights, being awake at night. It's peaceful and sort of like a whole different world. I do stay up until around noon, so it's not like I don't get to see daylight ever, but this schedule does not seem conducive to making new friends.

I play and record guitar, bass, synths, drums, and vocals. I don't have a band right now, but I'm hoping to put one together soon, and I'm hoping that playing my music live will help with meeting people. My music is sort of indie rock with some electronica. My musical tastes range from jazz like Ella Fitzgerald and Miles Davis, to bands like Tool and Radiohead. I was raised on The Beatles, Paul Simon, Billy Joel, Abba, classic rock. One of my favorite 'contemporary' bands is Pinback.

I like getting out and about when I can. There are so many great, beautiful places around Seattle to explore, hike, go camping, etc. I also enjoy traveling when I get the chance. I have been to Canada and Scotland and I'd like to visit many more places, take your pick.

I'm getting back into shape and I feel pretty good about it. I have a home gym where I work out about every other day. I'm also eating healthier; lots of vegetables and fewer carbs/sugar. I'm growing my own garden this year, too, so I'm excited about that.

So, yeah, that's a little about me, now how about you? Feel free to ask me anything, too. I look forward to hearing from you (ʘ‿ʘ)

title: Friends with dogs
text:
Let me start by urging you to read my post all the way through before you reply. I understand that common sense isn't very common and intelligence is not a gift that everyone has been granted... and I can work around that, to an extent, but if you blatantly disregard everything I've taken the time to write then you either won't get a reply or I won't be all that nice.... 

Soooo, I'm looking for someone who has a medium or large sized, friendly, playful dog(s) for my dog to play with. Recently started working more hours and my doberman is going stir crazy stuck at the house all day with 2 little dogs and now our normal walk routine just isn't cutting it. She has a super sweet temperament and gets along with every dog & person she meets. She doesn't play aggressively but she can get pretty vocal with playful growls, barks, and teeth chattering but she doesn't wrestle or bite. She LOVES to run!! More specifically she likes to be chased. In her glory days she could outrun just about any dog but now at 6 and a half she's slowed down just a tad but still has a very youthful energy. 

All that said, I think it's pretty obvious I love my dog.... :) I've spent the better part of the last 10 years working in the animal/pet field and don't particularly care for dog parks for multiple reasons, so if you have a large fenced in yard that's a huge plus (even better if it's grass or turf). If not, no prob, it's easy to think of or find something to do or somewhere to go. 

I'm legitimately more concerned about the compatibility of our dogs above anything else!! 
However, someone who shares similar interests or can at least hold a conversation is preferable. Bonus points for 420 friendly. Super bonus points if you have a good sense of humor and don't mind that my favorite words are swear words. Oh, and if you're cute it doesn't hurt either! ;) Sooo, I guess shoot me an email with a little bit about you and your pup and maybe a pic too so I know you're legit. If it sounds like a match you'll get our pic & we'll chit chat and set something up!

title: Seeking a Friend for the End of Boredom
text:
Hello out there. I figured I'd give this a shot again since I'm bored at home on a Saturday night...again.

First and foremost, I am totally heterosexual and looking for a STRICTLY PLANTONIC friend. I'm a 36 year old single black woman, never married, no children, not dating anyone. I live on my own in North Las Vegas, and I have my own transportation. I prefer to find new friends near this side of town since I don't really like driving. 

I listen to many types of music, including R&B, hip hop, reggae, dancehall, classic rock. I'm not into techno, house, heavy metal, or such music. I would like to go out to a club occasionally, like a few times a year, to get my groove on, but I am not into clubbing every weekend. On the rare occasion I do go to clubs, I prefer "grown and sexy" clubs for people 30 and up. I enjoy going to bars with live music. Before a close friend of mine moved to California, we would drink, chat, eat dinner and watch movies in the house...our movie nights were pretty fun. 

I enjoy going to Fremont Street for the most part and the Strip every now and again. I would like to try to go hiking again; I went some years ago, and it was pretty nice. I also want to see Lake Mead and/or Lake Las Vegas in the summer and Mt Charleston or somewhere else to see some snow and maybe go snow boarding in the winter.

I do not smoke weed or cigarettes, but understand that other people do, so I don't discriminate against them. I am a social drinker and will also have the occasional drink at home.

I'm not so much a girly girl. I'm not much into shopping, getting my hair done, or getting mani-pedis. I would like to get a massage every now and then though, and I would like to start a work out regimen in the near future.

Right now, most of my free time is spent laying around the house watching television. I'd like to change that and meet women around my age and with similar interests to do hang out with. Looks are unimportant...it's all about the personality! Although I work full time, I am on a strict budget, so anything we do would have to be reasonably priced or preferably free :-).

title: Seeking email pen pal with lots to say
text: Hi. I'm looking for a new friend. Yes, a platonic email pen pal -- but that sad little phrase makes it seem way too basic and cliché. It's really much more than that. Anything physical is off the table (and to be honest I don't really feel obligated to explain why right now). But who I am interested in connecting with, is the woman in the Starbucks line who took extra time that morning to dress nice, put on those boots she feels pretty and confident in, but then sighs and wonders why she bothered. Or the one who sits in the tub at night, drinking wine out of a coffee cup, who just finished sorting out all the kid runs for tomorrow, and the homework that's due, and amid the smell of lavender and make-up remover takes fifteen minutes to secretly hate the guts of her female unmarried friend who took that exotic vacation, and callously posted the pics on Facebook. We're not bitter people at our core, but we've battled through enough where some days a good ear to listen, a nap and a little agenda-less flirting sounds amazing. I'm actually a clean-cut, happy, hopeful and kind guy, non smoker, no drugs, no tattoos. I'm an attentive listener, I think I'm hilarious anyway. I'm basically just a dreamer/romantic who needs somewhere or someone for my musings and flirty words to land on. Maybe we can help each other. I don't live in NV but I get out there pretty often. Talk with you soon, Scott

title: 37 Year Old Single Biker with a BIG heart and a lot of time!
text:
Hope you are having a great day! Being incarcerated isn't all bad, especially if I hear from you it would be a lot better! I am incarcerated at a minimum security prison in South Dakota and am looking for a pen pal with a positive attitude. 
I have always been self-employed, my interests (outside of work) revolve around my three children and riding motorcycles. I live the motorcycle lifestyle 24/7 (except when I got sent to jail LOL). . .I am not just a weekend warrior! My life is an open book, if you want to know ANYTHING about me just ask. Right now I'm just looking for a pen pal, but a relationship is definitely a possibility. Relationships take time and I have lots of that since my release date is Feb 2019. 
I have lead a very interesting life and if you contact me I promise you will find my (pre prison) life quite entertaining and will also find that I am a fun loving genuine guy. . .. . .most say I am a teddy bear (with tattoos LOL)
I am currently in South Dakota (where I spent most of my life), but I find the thought of relocating appealing so don't worry about where you are living. I'm looking at all my options and am very excited to get my life back on track and also look forward to hearing from you. This is my first time in jail and am very clear that I am not coming back and realize that I need to make changes in my life to assure that won't happen again.
So if any of this sounds interesting to you, send me a letter and make sure you address it exactly the way I have written it (including your return address with your full name) otherwise I won't receive it (another one of those "jailhouse" rules). Some other details about me: Height 5'9", Weight 250, Eye: Brown, and Hair: Brown/Gray, muscular.
PS One more thing, I am open minded when it comes to age (over 21 please), race or body type but please just have a great sense of humor and a positive attitude! If you can include a photo with your letter I would appreciate that! I can forward a photo to you of me . . ...just ask!
I look forward to hearing from you!
William Waldner # 36455
Yankton Community Work Center
178 Mickelson Dr.
Yankton, SD 57078

title: Seeking ambitious, down-to-earth, lively girlfriends!!
text:
Hey ladies!

I am new to Vegas and need some girlfriends. I am originally from Orange County, CA but moved out here to pursue my dreams in entertainment. I have always loved Las Vegas and while some may dream of a recording deal or Broadway, Vegas is my broadway. I am a singer-songwriter and soon-to-be dancer (yes I'm talking gentlemen's club) so if you're judgmental about the adult entertainment industry we can't hang. I am seeking strictly platonic but have no time for petty bullshit so that's why I'm making all of that clear. Let me also make it clear that this is not an invitation for men to hit me up. I'm just looking for platonic girlfriends. So keep it moving. 

I need to get out of the house but I am not made of money yet so I need some down to earth girlfriends who like to have genuine conversations over coffee and get into nightclubs on guestlist. It would be great if you are also ambitious and pursuing your dreams so that we have something in common. 

I am very 420 friendly (in fact I'm in love with it) and I do drink but I prefer 420 so I will probably drink at a minimum unless I really want to go wild on occasion. 

I am 35, will be 36 in March (Aries!) I am silly, goofy, open-minded, crafty (painting, coloring, scrap-booking, journaling) and live for laughter. I also like talking about spiritual stuff like paranormal but I don't fuck around with it either but like to talk about stuff beyond this world. 

I love EDM, Acoustic, Open Mic Nights (I love to perform at these and meet other down to earth musicians), R&B, some Hip Hop and NO COUNTRY although a couple songs I'm okay with (like Cruise by Florida Georgia Line and Girl Crush by Little Big Town...recent interactions have taught me to try to keep an open mind and not be arrogant about my preferences) and I do love hanging out on the strip. I don't care about the "locals don't go to the strip" rule. I don't give a shit about that. So if you still love walking down the strip and acting like a tourist then we will get along very well!!! Life is short, let's make memories here in the best magical city on the west coast where we are privileged to call it a stay-cation whenever we want. If you're from out of town that would be cool too as we can both probably appreciate the magic of this town without feeling desensitized to it. 

I was living in Henderson but am temporarily back in Cali but will be visiting as much as possible until I move back to Vegas this summer. I just want to start connecting with people so that Vegas really feels like home when I return for good. So bring on the girlfriends!! Let's make memories!!

~Natalie

title: a geeky homebody looking for other geeky homebodies to hang with
text:
TL;DR 35yo geeky gal looking for GEEKY FRIENDS of any shape or size or orient that are okay with chilling at home

So I've moved from the SF Bay Area to Vegas a couple of years back because it was getting too expensive there and didn't feel like moving back in with the 'rents so for a while, I was just trying to get my ducks back in a row and out of the daily/weekly/monthly place my roommate and I could afford at the time. 

Now that we're in a much better apartment, I'm hoping to find some 30ish geeky folks to call friends. I only know a handful of folk here and they're kinda already set up with their own band of friends to hang with. I swear, moving is like being in high school again...

I work from home Tue-Sat 4pm-midnight, which is during the hours that most people have free time, so it'd be cool if folks were okay with just hanging out at mine, either cooking something up or ordering in (LOVE that Vegas has so much delivery variety), doing Netflix/Hulu/Amazon marathons (I'm down to watch just about anything as I watch anything from Doctor Who to Downton Abbey to Fresh Off the Boat to How I Met Your Mother...I just like being entertained and laughing), doing some couch co-op video gaming (got Wii U, PS4 and X1 with Kinect so we can look absolutely derp) or even card/board games (currently have Exploding Kittens (it's really not as bad as it sounds, Google it) and Sushi Go!).

Drinking is fine but just not to excess (I will take your keys and wait til you nap it off). I'm fine with vaping inside but if you're actually lighting up a cigarette, I'll ask you to step outside. I'm not your mom but please no drugs, 420 or otherwise, if we're hanging at my place.

Oh, I should mention for allergy sakes that I have a cat named Glitch and a mischief of ratties- 6 girls (Isabeau, Kenzi, Lauren, Cosima, Helena, Yue) and 2 boys (Bacchus, Daisuke)

I'm so down to go out on my days off to try new delicious food or go to festivals, events or musicals/bands. My transportation is a wee bit limited as I'm puttering around on a 50cc scooter but there's always carpooling or I can Uber/Lyft.

Or heck, if you wanna get to know me while gaming, I'd be happy to give you my XBL, PSN or Steam handle. I'm not much of a PVP MP gamer any more (got WAY to burnt out on CS and TF2) but always down for some co-op on Halo, Destiny, Dying Light, etc.

Seriously, I crave folks to hang out with. I'm starting to go a bit stir crazy like Anna in Frozen. @_@;

title: Tired of coming home to a mess!?
text:
Okay, so I thought I would post this here since it seems this is where the majority of men-women go. And I will SPECIFY that I am NOT looking for a LTR or anything casual either. I am a heterosexual woman.

I am looking to exchange my Personal Assistant services for MY own ROOM in your apt or home. 

This is ideal for someone who has an EXTRA ROOM they normally do not use and also you do not need the $ help of a roommate. Maybe you just work insane hours! And when you get home you are just too tired to tend to any kind of domestic duties... but, of course, they pile up. 

Perhaps we start out slow. We do a ONE week trial. See how it goes..... I have a place now so it would not be a big deal to just come back to it. Not a lease here though; it's one of my best friend's place but I cannot stand all the clutter here. 

Imagine coming home to a clean home every day. How about a delicious home cooked meal 2-3 x a week? No more weekends spent on grocery shopping, dropping off and picking up dry cleaning. Maybe you're a single mom and need a little help with the kids or would love to go out on a date-girls night and not have to worry about paying a sitter? I also have many years working as a professional Nanny--great references. 

I will do everything on a schedule. Deep cleaning every two weeks. Cooking 2-3 x a week. Grocery shopping-errands 1 x a week. As far as daily maintenance goes I expect you to clean up after yourself because I am not going to be your maid. So if you are an actual slob, this will not work.... 

I just moved here and am still looking for work. Have so many great leads.... so just trying to save $ to buy another car. 

Had a long stressful day? I will be in my room out of your way; it will be like I am not even there. But more than likely I will be working at night or on weekends. It will be the best of both worlds for you; a clean place, fresh cooked meals, less errands.... . 

This would be a totally PLATONIC situation based on trust and respect. That is the only way it would work. A fair exchange. And who knows, maybe we would become good friends. 

A little about me? Woman in her forties. Non drinker or smoker (I expect same as far as smoking goes), no drugs, no drama, very easy to get along with. No criminal history and expect same. Quiet. Kind. Responsible. Clean. Creative. 

If interested, let me know. Why let your spare room go to waste? OR if you know of someone who could benefit from this kind of arrangement (male or female), please pass this along to them.

Every month we could discuss how things are going. Openly. Honestly. What is working well and what is not. Like adults. If it's not working so well I can move on. Simple as that. I only have what fits into two suitcases and a few bags. Plus my darling indoor-outdoor cat. 

Please do not flag this post; have a heart. It's totally legit from a real person. No games.

title: Question for the ladies
text:
You're dating a girl but you guys haven't made anything official yet. You guys are not in a serious relationship, you're just getting to know each other. Is it a problem if she dates other men? She's not your girlfriend, so it shouldn't be a problem, right? 

I am only asking because I am currently in this situation. I am 100% single. I go on dates, and talk to a few guys. I'm not a wh*re or anything. I don't sleep around with them. I just like to keep my options open. Last night I went on a date after work, and he completely caused a scene and embarrassed the hell out of me, lol. I told him that I was in fact dating two other men. I didn't feel like it had to be a secret. I was just being honest and I don't feel like it's that big of a deal. He, on the other hand, felt like it was a huge deal. He reacted as if I was cheating on him. 

Am I wrong? Or did he overreact? 

I mean, I never said I was his girlfriend or anything. We were just enjoying each other's time and getting to know each other. Dating multiple people is fine, when you're single.... right?

I do want to throw in that I am not looking for someone to date or hook up with. I just need an answer to my question. Please do not contact me wanting to meet up or go on a date. I do not meet men online. I feel like anyone who needs to go online to meet people, either has some serious issues on the outside, or on the inside. I don't trust it. Haha sorry. Feel free to answer my question tho. If not keep on reading ads and I wish you luck on finding someone.

title: E-Mail Freinds
text:
JUST A NOTE: I AM NOT LOCAL, OR EVEN IN THE SAME STATE. NOT LOOKING FOR SEX, DRUGS, A JOB OR ANYTHING BUT SOME GOOD CONVERSATIONS AND IF WE CLICK MAYBE A FRIEND DOWN THE ROAD!!! 

I have always thought that to have a friend you have to be a friend.

So what am I looking for: just some good friend's, casual acquaintances or even a stranger who wants an opinion and then fades away like a ship in the night. Let's discuss the highs and lows of the day, or whatever comes up in conversation?

ME: I am a married white male, been married for 14 years and deeply love my wife. Not looking for a replacement or something on the side. I might be changing my situation and could use a sounding board. I may vent about her at times and wonder why men and women fall in love if we don't seem to understand the other gender.

I am a down to earth, level headed, thoughtful person, who takes life as it comes. I am a good listener and like to think I give good advice, I might not be able to do anything about a problem, but the greatest gift we can give another is a moment in time we will never get back. I have a sarcastic sense of humor, something of a smart ass, I am reserved until I get to know someone, although I am curious and will ask a question just to see what the answer is. I am educated, with an AA and AS also a handful of technical certificates, Computer Service Technician, Early Childhood Education and truck driver.

I have a wide variety of interests. I read constantly, some favorites include urban fantasy, sci-fi, westerns, thrillers, and mysteries. I also read history, computer books--love the Dummies series, self-help books and woodworking/crafts. I am a big fan of the Marvel movies currently coming out, also enjoy comedies, drama and of course action, I am a guy after all. I am interested in computers and web design just getting into doing some graphic design and programing. Photography, putt putt golf, shooting sports is just some things I do for fun. As for TV I am a big fan of HGTV, Food Network, History and Travel Channels. I like most types of music, mainly country, with some 50-60's rock (think the Beach Boys, Jan and Dean), jazz, blues some pop.

YOU: Have an opinion or interest in something, be ready to talk about it, be able to carry on an intelligent conversation. Have interests, thoughts and dreams. Not concerned with the superficial things like race, gender or any labels, I judge people by their actions and words. Basically I am asking that you be human, or even a Martian with all the faults and experiences that make us all unique and an individual. I am not looking for someone just like me, I feel we all learn and are enriched by our differences.

Not looking to exchange photos right away, maybe down the road it would be nice to put a face with the words on the screen. I would like to get to know you as a person and hope that you feel the same.
So tell me about yourself, your history, your dreams, your darkest fear or greatest joy, whatever you want to share. Change the title to favorite TV show.

title: ~ * ~ Call In Your Tribe ~ * ~
text:
Love guides all whose heart and mind is willing. It does it so gently that we often miss it because we're not paying attention. But when we slow down and tune deeply into our heart, we cannot help but feel the exquisite alignment of it all.

And knowing how that kind of alignment feels, we reach a point of no return in our spiritual journey. It literally becomes impossible to compromise ourselves at any level or in any area.

We begin to see how long we tried to make some things work. We see how long we held on so tightly to jobs, to relationships, to lower energy beliefs and ideas. We see how long it took us to leave people and situations where our magnificence wasn't seen much less honored. Our light was not appreciated. Our gifts were not valued. We see where we started to shrink so we could fit in. And we see how painful it all was.

Thus we begin to walk away quietly. Gracefully. Centered not frazzled. Even though we might still shed a few tears. We walk away from anyone who shows no real interest in living a heart-centered life of deep appreciation and sweet harmony.

We walk away knowing there are others out there who long for peace as much as we do, and who are willing to do whatever it takes to make sure we find ways to build one another up instead of tearing each other down.

We begin, little by little, --consciously or unconsciously-- to call forth our Tribe. We call forth our brothers and sisters from other mothers. And one by one, they start to show up in our lives in the most beautiful ways!

And I believe it is these Tribes that will change the whole course of humanity.

title: Traveling Companion Wanted
text:
Let me be clear. This is NOT an ad offering FREE CRUISES; just someone nice to share the experiences with. My traveling companion also gets the same rate I do as a travel agent so it makes for a less expensive trip for both of us.

I am NOT looking for someone who wants a Free Ride, Expecting me to foot the bill. I am NOT looking for that kind of companion; just someone else who loves to travel, can afford to do so but like me, hates to do it alone.

If you love exploring new places, cultures or even just a quickie cruise to Mexico let's talk.

I have cruised all over the Caribbean, Mexico, Central America, Europe and Hawaii. I am looking forward to doing some River Cruises in Europe as well as possibly another transatlantic Florida to Europe followed by some river cruises.

Sometimes cruises come up last minute and some are farther out so if you are flexible, great. If you have a certain time you are available, maybe we can work around it.

Looking for someone preferably over 40 so we have more in common and can enjoy each others company. Please be a Non-Smoker as I am......

I am a straight up kind of guy so honesty is important. No Flakes Need Respond !
Lets get acquainted and plan some fun adventures.


Talk soon? Garry

title: Looking to make Friends to tattoo

I am an artist/ tattoo apprentice. I am an apprentice with Professional Artist Angelo Mayfield aka Kidd of Vegas Ink Tattoo Shop. I am looking to do my style of work on individuals, and palm sized tattoos (traditional rose, crosses, script, pinups, anchors, etc.) Here are a few things you need to know and expect before contacting me. I will NOT do fingers, hands, feet, necks, heads, please do not ask. I will do an idea, if it is well thought out or at least are willing to hear feedback. Please do not ask me to draw something for you, and you have no direction on WHAT YOU WANT ON YOUR BODY! Serious inquiries only, my time is valuable. You should be flexible in your scheduling with me and be willing to work thru late nights. I have photos of my work previously done as well as sketchbook photos. Must contact via email to become a viewer.

Tattoos and art are not being sold. However, donations are encouraged for the professional experience and supplies included. I want to reiterate that their is no pricing. It is not about the money, it's about appreciation and mutual respect. My goal is to grow both my tattooing clientele and my portfolio. Canvases may even possibly receive free tattoos depending on size of work and loyalty to artist.

title: new nearby friends / activity partners

title: Conversation & Thoughts of Men & Women of Today, Feel Free To Chime In
text:
i was having a conversation with a friend and we were speaking about men and women of today. I am 40yrs old, well traveled and diverse in many things. I shared with him my recent cab experience and i will share it with you as well.... Thought I'd share my conversation with CL and see the variety of opinions and thoughts..

I took a cab while here in Vegas once. The cab driver was Middle Eastern & informed me he was from Atlantic City with piqued my curiosity. I asked why he left AC to drive a taxi in Vegas. Seemed like a lateral move to me. He said his wife got a promotion at Caesar's so the family moved. He continued "you know how these women are, they start making more money than you and everything changes." His words, not mine. He then continued that he hadn't seen his children in 6yrs and he planned to move to Michigan to start his life over. I then shared my insight. I told him i can never be upset with a woman being a woman. I told him, "you can't lead from the rear of the side, only from the front!" Once you let a woman catch you, you're no longer interesting to them. We have to stay out front but too many men get complacent and comfortable. 

We teach our daughters not to choose a man who isn't about anything then brilliantly deduce they're only with him because he's about something. Men lie about their finances because they're aware of the appeal and most men panic when they're income is in trouble for the same reason. How often have we seen women file for divorce when the ride is clearly over? Everything men do is to catch the attention of women. Heterosexual men at least. Our finances represent our "prowess" to the basic instinct. It's hard wired in women's DNA to select a man who can provide for her and her brood. That was at one time a "mighty hunter." Todays "MIGHTY HUNTER" is the financial giant. Women associate wealth with power and what woman doesn't find power attractive? I'll wait. Men get the most attractive woman they can afford and women get the most successful man thy can attract. There's a lot of angry unsuccessful men and bitter unattractive women. Such is life.

title: Who wants to make money together?
text:
I know the title sounds like a scam but it's real.

I'm looking into a career in over the road truck driving (big rigs) and the company I'm interested in is team driver oriented. They will train us for free for a CDL license (IT'S NOT EASY), send us our separate ways for a month or so with trainers and then we'd urite again. We'd live out of our truck, although there's hometime every few weeks you generally need to be ready to leave everything behind. After 6 months to a year, much better paying driving jobs become available to us (local and dedicated routes, etc.) and you'll have a well paying career in your pocket without the college bullshit.

These companies are very strict about drug testing. Don't bother if you currently have a habit. This wouldn't happen for a month or two but we could hang out and see if we can manage to not kill eachother in the meantime. For the record team drivers work in shifts -- one person drives while the other sleeps, which allows massive miles to be obtained and we're paid by the mile.

Men preferred, heterosexual only, absolutely nothing but a professional friendship. Women are ok too but need to know how to put a very hard days work in. You will need some recent work experience to get into this field but drivers are very much in demand so it doesn't have to be much. You must be 25+ to drive for most companies.

title: moving to vegas this summer
text:
so this could be m4w too, will finds his grace type thing. basically i'm a gay man moving to las vegas soon and i would like to get a head start on making some friends. men, women, unsure, straight, gay, undecided, what ever. i don't know anyone in vegas and if i could change that, even if to get advice on the city and never meet up...i'd be a step further ahead than i am now. however, it would be ideal to stay in contact with someone i could throw back some beers with when i finally do arrive.

so about me....

i'm a cancer, like a textbook cancer. i'm typically quiet and i'm not just a "good listener" because i let others talk, but because i retain the information i take in. at first, my sexual orientation surprises people. my shell is rugged, scruffy, and masculine to protect the fact that i'm really shy and unsure of myself. i can get along with anyone because i'm easily amused, hard to offend, and all together laid back. however, i'll have the best times with someone who tends to be more outspoken and might need a dose of emotional valium i can provide.

my ideal saturday night would be to host a small group of friends for drinks and appetizers. i'm a really good cook and it's something i enjoy doing very much. if going out somewhere, i love to people watch, society is the best television out there and one of my favorite things to do in vegas is to sit in a corner, order some drinks, become a wallflower, and discuss the world in front of you with someone else.

i have pretty eclectic music tastes. i tend to answer the common question with "classic rock" but it's everything from floyd and zeppelin to billie holiday and toni price to mazzy star and joy division to pearl jam and stp to beyonce and rihanna to willie nelson and leeann womack...and the list keeps going. it's rare to find someone who can surprise me with music, but really cool when it does happen. i also enjoy computer, console, and even card games. i'm forever on the search for 3 other people to play canasta partners with.

there are several reasons i chose vegas as the location to start my new chapter in life. above all it's my goal to create a positive experience for myself and those around me. if you think you would like to be one of those people, holla. thanks for reading and take it easy.

title: active friends wanted
text:
Hi all! 

I am in search of new friends - preferably friends that like to be/get active. I srarted to really change things in my life and I don't want to waste it sitting around doing nothing. 

Don't get me wrong, I do enjoy a nice dinner and chatting, movies, watching Netflix - but I am looking to get out and do more and it seemed like a good idea to find like minded friends that I wont feel like I have to beg/drag along. 

Things I would Iike to do: hike, swim, days st the lake, running (I'm a slow walk/run person, but doing half marathons and hopefully my first full this year), tennis (I am dying to find someone who enjoys just hitting the ball arund), roller skating, bicycling (have a road bike, need to build miles), and anything else you can think of. I have a tent that is barely used, I'd live to change that. 

I've lived in Vegas for 10 years and last year was the first year I was really an active person. I'd love to see all of the things I have been missing out on this whole time. Red Rock (actual hikes/runs, not just the scenic loop), Valley of Fire, Mt. Charleston, Lake Mead, etc. I've been to them, but I haven't explored any of them. Anyone want to join me?

I am 33 and married, just looking for friends. If you're single, dating someone, engaged, married, whatever, you're welcome here. It would be super cool if you were also interested in hanging out with the both of us from time to time (or even do double date type activities) but not a requirement for friendship. 

I'm honest, genuine, caring, goofy, sarcastic and down to earth. I like to be a good person and try not to let people down. If we make plans, I do my best to be early and not ever flake (though sometimes life does happen). I am employed full time and usually available evenings and weekends, along with most Fridays. I'll always be an equal party to the friendship. 

I drink rarely/socially. I don't smoke or do ANY drugs. What you do is your business, but would prefer non/light smokers and non-drug users. If you're into pot and think we would actually still get along, I'd just ask that you don't do it or have it around me. 

Anyway, if you're looking for good friends, hit me up. If you'd like to use messengers, I have yahoo and kik, just let me know.

title: SUMMER TRAVEL COMPANION
text:
OK, this is my first time posting on CL personals. Had to get that out of the way. I am a retired White male, 64, 6' tall, slender build, blond, blue, 'stache. I love the outdoors and am planning several trips to western states this coming summer. I have a late model 23' travel trailer which is clean, fully equipped with kitchen, bathroom, separate beds, and roomy enough for two people. I am looking for a travel companion to join me to experience the wonders of nature. You must also like the outdoors. I am planning some hiking, mountain biking (I have a second one for you to ride), also some swimming (always on the prowl for a righteous new swimming hole). I love music and have a good portable setup for tunes wherever we camp or picnic or set up at the lakeside, etc. I have a portable sun shelter and pretty much all the gear needed. You get to sleep on the sofa bed, or if you prefer more privacy, I have a tent and king size air mattress or you can sleep in the back of the SUV on a foam pad.

So here's the deal: my travel companion I had in 2014 due to health issues can no longer do it. My good friend and tripping buddy died last September and I have no one else to travel with. I am looking for someone who gets the entire the summer off and can come along each time I hook up the trailer to head off on some new adventure, preferably a college or UNLV student who won't be needing to get a summer job, or a teacher, prefer younger, to 45ish. Need someone who can keep up with me on the trails, so no overweight, or smokers or badly out of shape people. If you've ever hiked at 9,000+ feet, you know how it can get you winded if you're not used to it. Looking for someone HW proportionate. I am not some sort of super fitness buff and do everything at a relatively relaxed pace, but truthfully, I am hoping to get into better shape than I am now, and this is one way to do it. I am not an Xtreme mountain biker. BTW, I am a gravity rider for the most part so I go where they run the lifts. Don't like humping it up miles long grades. This arrangement would be of special interest to a student from some other parts of the country, possibly even a foreign student, as you will get to see some of the beautiful wonders we have out West.

For your part, you ride for free as I am going to hit the road regardless. I won't ask for, or expect, a dime for gas, food, camping fees, sex, or anything else, except that your role is to be navigator/co-pilot, and do your share of the work. Yes, sorry to say camping involves work, but with a trailer it's way better and easier than tent camping, so I expect you to keep the car and trailer tidy and clean, do your share with meal prep/planning, food shopping, and help with gathering firewood etc. Just towing that thing takes a lot out of me as it never lets you forget you have it back there and you have to pay more attention while driving, but I'm not going to be especially demanding; we share everything and work as a team.

I'm not doing this just to get laid and won't be like an octopus and keep my hands to myself; if more than a nice new mutual friendship comes of this, then I won't fight it, but I just don't want to travel alone this summer. I don't know any people who can break away for the summer and most of my friends are too out of shape for the things I like to do anyway.

Places I plan to go: Mammoth Mountain for some mountain biking, then Yosemite for some sightseeing and hiking including Cloud's Rest, Mist Trail, top of Yosemite Falls. Maybe Lake Tahoe for some hiking and mtn. biking. Sonoma County for some hiking mtn. biking, swimming, sightseeing. Oregon for some sightseeing, hiking, mtn. biking. Possibly Park City Utah for mtn. biking and riding the Alpine Coaster and zip line. Brian Head for mtn. biking. And Zion for hiking and sightseeing and Bryce Canyon for hiking and sightseeing. I should mention that I plan to visit with some friends/relatives in some of the places I am going, so you may be asked to stay behind at camp and entertain yourself while I am away, but that shouldn't be a problem.

I am making preliminary plans now and trying to lock in reservations at campsites and set up the itinerary. This could be a really memorable summer of fun for both of us......the kind of memories you cherish years later. I would like to get acquainted with a potential travel partner ahead of time so we are not total strangers come summer. If you are not much of a bike rider, we can ride some of the paved trails near my house so you can get your skills up. Mountain biking is not all that difficult and I stay away from the diamond and double diamond trails anyway. I do it just to enjoy the scenery and breathe the clean mountain air. 

Anyone who is interested contact me, tell me a bit about yourself and if you think you could fit into this scenario. I'll send pic for pic. We can meet up someplace neutral for a 'chemistry check' like a restaurant, and if there is some potential there, I can bring you by to look at my trailer so you can decide if you'd be comfortable calling it home for several weeks this summer. I'm a fairly easy person to get along with. I really dig music and have eclectic tastes from Manowar to Dean Martin and everything in between. I have a really nice entertainment setup with a BluRay player, 32" TV, good speakers with subwoofer so we can watch a movie at night if we're not sitting by a campfire each night. 

I guess I'll stop here before this gets too lengthy. Please don't respond if you're some kinda hooker, deadbeat, drug/crack addict, freeloader on welfare, psychic basket case, can't swim, smoke cigarettes (deal killer). I am cool with ink, piercings, punk/gothic/ steampunk, geeky, nerdy, Deadhead types and just plain ordinary women. Stimulating intellectual conversation a ++. I am 420 friendly, but don't do it myself although I like to have an occasional glass of wine or Mike's hard lemon, and I like to huff some laughing gas from time to time. I'll only have you along if you are a responsible person. Anyway, that's all for now. Please read my ad carefully before responding. And thanx for looking!
interests: Outdoors, music, reading, computer, history, science, cars, gardening

I have no problem if you're open to the possibilities, but if you are a person who thinks they have all the answers, and spends all their time looking at conspiracy websites...We're not going to be good friends eventually.

title: Sad and lonely
text:
But I've always felt this way. Even as a child, I knew I would feel this for the rest of my life. 

Even when I am around people I am sad and lonely. 

I try to feel something else. Another emotion. If I push away the sadness and loneliness, I feel empty. I look into my eyes and they are always watering. I have the saddest, emptiest looking eyes. 

Sometimes when I'm around people I get panic attacks. I want so badly to make friends. But when I'm around people, they are too fixated on their own agendas. No one wants to open up anymore. You have the same little short conversations with hundreds of people. And then you never see them again. Or worse, you briefly pass by them and they act like you are friends. I have a million acquaintances now from having little conversations with people, but I don't really know them. 

I jump into relationships with people. When I'm in a relationship at least they temporarily numb the sadness. I still feel lonely. I feel inadequate, I feel like a fraud. I feel like an ugly beast with no depth. When will this person realize that I'm a terribly, empty, sad being.

So I end the relationship. 

And search for someone else to numb my sadness until I end that one and begin again.

I'm just so sad and lonely.

title: Las Vegas Vacationer looking for lady for conversations and dining
text:
I'm an Asian male, 5'7", 175 pounds. I go to Las Vegas once or twice a year for the past 8 years or so and it gets boring going to restaurants/buffets/shows alone so I'm looking for a lady to accompany me to some restaurants and perhaps some shows... it might be one time or a few times. I don't mind picking up the tab for the dining/show but we must be comfortable/compatible with one another so...

1) I am not looking for a "professional lady" (i.e. no prostitutes/hookers)
2) Not looking for a gold digger (don't expect me to pay for everything)
3) Height/weight proportionate (I would say that I'm average build at 5'7" and 175 pounds and can afford to perhaps lose ~10 pounds)
4) Not heavily tattooed or facial piercings (I don't have any)
5) Not into doing drugs (I don't do any drugs)
6) Non smoker (I am a non-smoker)
7) Can drink but not excessively (as I drink occasionally).
8) Must love buffets... and not be a vegetarian :-)
9) Between 21 and early 50s (I'm in my 40's but people have told me that like most Asians, I appear younger).

I will be in Las Vegas from Wednesday April 20 to Monday April 25.

For both our safety, we will meet in public (generally inside one of the casinos on the Strip/Downtown or in front of the restaurant/show).

If you're interested in meeting up, please don't hesitate to reply and tell me a bit about yourself along with sending a picture.

title: Wanna meet Kenny G tonight?
text:
Do you like smooth jazz and cool dudes? If you answered "yes" and "fuck yes," then today is your lucky day.

Long story, but a friend of mine won tickets and backstage passes for a Kenny G concert tonight at The Venetian. He will be attending the concert and meeting Kenny G himself in person tonight. 

But here's the thing -- he's all alone. And as you may have noticed, I said "tickets." 

You probably know where this is going.

Are you his +1? Maybe. But we have pretty high standards. You must be:

1.) Alive.

That's pretty much it. 

No strings attached, nothing weird or creepy. 

Just a couple of people going to enjoy some smooth jazz and backstage for a "meet and greet" with none other than saxophone legend Kenny G. 

He's in his mid-20s (25ish? not totally sure) and a really nice guy.

So what's up, Vegas?

Note: Pics are of Kenny G, not my friend. 

Second Note: This is 100% for real.

title: "Sensitive people are the most genuine and honest people you will ever
text:
"Sensitive people are the most genuine and honest people you will ever meet. There is nothing they won't tell you about themselves if they trust your kindness. However, the moment you betray them, reject them or devalue them, they become the worse type of person. Unfortunately, they end up hurting themselves in the long run. They don't want to hurt other people. It is against their very nature. They want to make amends and undo the wrong they did. Their life is a wave of highs and lows. They live with guilt and constant pain over unresolved situations and misunderstandings. They are tortured souls that are not able to live with hatred or being hated. This type of person needs the most love anyone can give them because their soul has been constantly bruised by others. However, despite the tragedy of what they have to go through in life, they remain the most compassionate people worth knowing, and the ones that often become activists for the broken hearted, forgotten and the misunderstood. They are angels with broken wings that only fly when loved." 
― Shannon L. Alder

title: Just looking for someone to chat with.
text:
Everything now seems like it's all about sex, and frankly, I personally am not really into that, nor am I looking for it. I have to have an emotional connection to you to even consider it, so if you're just looking for a hook up, go ahead and hit the back button. This posting isn't for you.
I feel like I've recently pushed all my friends away due to emotional bs and honestly I just want to forget all that for a little while and have conversation that isn't about my own drama. Real, intellectual conversation. Idc what it's about; comics, movies, anything really. I like to think of myself as a pretty well-rounded person.
I'm 19 years old, white, 420 accepting (though I don't and won't do it myself - I don't react well to it). I prefer to keep our conversation through tech, unless we really hit it off. Then I might be willing to meet up irl. 
For just conversation, age, gender, and ethnicity don't matter to me, but for prospect of meeting up one day, I'd feel more comfortable if you're 18-24 y.o.

title: Donald Trump Un-Fan Club
text:
Are you like millions of Americans who find themselves lying awake at night wondering what tortured shade of yellow animal pelt is balancing on Donald Trump's head every day? Have you ever laughed at Ted Cruz, but secretly been grateful that he is sticking around for Republican voters who are not yet insane? Does the uncanny resemblance of Trump's lips and eyeballs make your skin curl a little bit? Have you ever blinked? 

If you answered yes to any of the above questions, we want you! And by we, I really just mean me. I have zero affiliation with Donald Trump, but I do have an idea for a fun hobby.

It's called Something Clever Against Trump. Here is the mission: after receiving thousands of follow up emails, I will tirelessly sift through them in order to assemble a team of Recruited Awesome People (RAPs). What will the RAPs do? 

RAPs will convene at a later determined location and then fill out job applications for the TRUMP hotels. "This sounds fucking terrible!" you exclaim. I agree. But here's the real fun: at the end of the applications there is a section for a cover letter. It's just a big white, scroll-able text box waiting to be filled with scathing commentary about Donald Trump and his pathetic campaign and saddening hair. 

I am not going to pay anyone anything (but if we meet up at a pizza place I might eat some of your pizza). Again, you will not be paid any money. I think the real reward here is coming together with a group of level headed people who dislike Donald Trump (what kind of fucking name is Donald?) and writing angry letters to him in a way that he will have to hear about if there are enough people doing this. Let's have our voices heard! 

Please email me or respond to this ad if you have literally any comments or interest in this.

title: OK HOW ABOUT THIS
text:
Hey I know you are looking around. There are a ton of guys on here. We all have our quirks. Me?, I lost my hearing a few years back, but that has not slowed me down. Sure its a challenge but far from a disability. I do drive and have a car, yes deaf people can drive. We eat, sleep, have fun just like everyone else. You will be surprised how loud us hearing impaired can be!
I read lips just fine, so don't worry about using sign language. Just tap me on the wrist or shoulder to get my attention and allow me to see your mouth while you talk. And yes I really am looking and reading your lips. Unless you want me to look somewhere else. 
Let's get out....Let's go to museums, or art shows, or trail hike, play a game, road tripping..a bag of munchies a drink and a road to explore. Get a bite to eat. If you are deaf as well, we can figure out our own sign language. Most people don't know sign language but we all use our body to speak. Hand gestures, we nod, smile, shrug. A lot of signs for the deaf is just like that. They mimic what we do in life. Learning to sign as well as to what is called "hand speak" gets me everywhere. At work I just use a speach to text app. It is really that easy. 
So give us a try, give me a fun chance. The deaf are louder than you think.!!!!!

title: Golden Years
text:
Divorced and retired man here. I'm just looking for another guy my age who lives nearby (215/Charleston)to hang out with, go places with, and enjoy life together. I don't care if you are straight, gay, or bi like me. I don't smoke, not even 420. I only drink occasionally and I quit taking drugs when I decided to become a CPA back in my twenties. I'm not into what's hip and happening. I like walking in nature and cooking chicken on the BBQ. I watch NOVA and NATURE on PBS and laugh at the zany antics of the politicians in this year's presidential primary race.
Life isn't a ride on the Love Boat. It's more like a roller-coaster where you begin heading in one direction and then suddenly find yourself headed in another. There are ups and downs but when you look back at the ride you've taken even the harrowing drops were exciting. Pain and suffering aren't fun. They hurt. But sometimes they are an important part of our lives and failure can be the best teacher. I CHOSE to marry my ex-wife No one forced me to say "I do". When she abandoned me at the weakest point of my life, well, that was clearly a bad decision. MY mistake. No one else's. Not my first, nor my last. We all have baggage. We all have drama. It's called life. But life goes on. We're lucky it does. Time heals all wounds. Our purpose here on Earth is to enjoy what we have and to help others to do the same. Life is simple. Eat, sleep, smile, and defecate from time to time. I'm smiling now. 
I would enjoy my life more if I had more people in it and one special person to share it with. Whether we spend the afternoon strolling at the dog park or an evening with our faces between each others' legs, it's all good.

Thanks for reading this far. Write me if you're interested in talking or meeting.

title: Looking for an honest conversation... or three
text:
Not gonna lie... I'm married. I've been contemplating getting a divorce because after 10 years, the passion has died. I'm not looking for a storybook romance, and can hardly expect one in a marriage, but I have a lot to give and (I believe) a lot to receive. 

I will probably get some hate mail, and I expect it, but I'm really looking for someone in a similar situation who thinks that her marriage can be salvaged. Yes, perhaps whom I'm looking for is free counseling (lol) but I want to be able to talk or text or email someone who can empathize and talk me off the ledge, so to speak. I think marriages are worth saving if there is no cheating or any other physical atrocities involved, and I'm definitely not in one like that.

Help me understand what a woman wants, or needs. Especially if physical or emotional contact is/has been the primary driver of your deteriorating relationship.

I'm not looking to fall into the arms of a woman who reaches out; far from it - I'm looking to connect with someone who can give me the advice I need to spark things off again.

Please help me. This is a humble plea from a fairly vulnerable person who is taking his problems to the cloud. In an unconventional sort of way.
